verses.roman:
sarveṣām iha bhūtānām
eṣa hi prabhavāpyayaḥ
goptā ca tad-avadhyāyī
na kvacit sukham edhate

synonyms: sarveṣām—of all; iha—in this world; bhūtānām—living beings; eṣaḥ—this (Śrī Kṛṣṇa); hi—certainly; prabhava—the origin; apyayaḥ—and disappearance; goptā—the maintainer; ca—and; tat—of Him; avadhyāyī—one who is neglectful; na kvacit—never; sukham—happily; edhate—prospers.
translation: Lord Kṛṣṇa causes the appearance and disappearance of all beings in this world, and He is their maintainer as well. One who disrespects Him can never prosper happily.
